input_text:
Job Title: Marketing Operations Associate (Remote)

Location: California, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Join us on our mission to create a completely new, 100% digital bank that truly serves customers' best interests. We are a close-knit and fun-loving team of seasoned financial services professionals who came together for the challenge of building a bank from scratch - and we are committed to doing it all the right way (from technology infrastructure to modern marketing to customer experience).

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $77,000.00 and $109,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

We work with the flexibility and speed of a start-up. But we also have significant stability and capital from being part of the SMBC Group (Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation). SMBC is the second largest bank in Japan and the 12th largest bank in the world with operations in over forty countries. And SMBC is committed to disrupting the US marketplace with ground-breaking products.

It is the best of both worlds, and we are seeking proven marketing leaders to propel us towards a national launch. We have both the ambitious growth plans and the 'patient capital' necessary to execute a multi-year plan. Join us on the journey to deliver an exciting concept of evolved banking.

Summary

Jenius Bank is seeking an experienced Marketing Operations professional within the Marketing Team. This role will report into the VP, Marketing Operations and will lead and assist across all MOps responsibilities with specific focus on Process Operations. These responsibilities include but are not limited to planning and workflow management, procedural management, training and enablement, vendor procurement, MarTech platform ownership, quality controls, and best practices. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working in Marketing Operations and supporting B2C strategies in a highly collaborative and dynamic organization.

Princpal Duties & Responsibilities

Create/Modify Process Maps (workflow management) to help the Marketing Team increase efficiency and improve collaboration Write Procedures & Job-Aids for MOps owned items (E.g., Braze, Knak, Atlassian, IntelligenceBank), and consult/guide other Marketing Team members for their owned items (E.g., Sprinklr, SEMrush, Contentful, Google Marketing Platform, Merkury, SearchStax) Assist in supporting MOps Office Hours and facilitating trainings for MOps owned procedures and Job-Aids to help the Marketing Team maximize capabilities and platforms Manage quality control activities that help ensure assets, procedures, controls, and job-aids are accurate, in compliance with required review cycles, and functioning effectively Own and manage Marketing taxonomies (E.g., Campaigns and Assets) Manage Marketing PM Tooling that enables proper intake, evaluation, and prioritization of activities in collaboration with PM resource and other Marketing Team initiative leaders Assist Marketing Team with vendor procurement and renewal activities in collaboration with Vendor Operations Manage marketing capabilities intake process and oversee implementation in coordination with assigned Marketing Team leader and PM resource Assist with Platform Ownership responsibilities of selected Marketing Team owned operational platforms – managing the development and evolution of for greater efficiency and capability. 

Position Specfications

A minimum of 5 years' experience in Marketing with a keen understanding of how marketing processes work together and affect each otherA minimum of 2 years’ experience assessing marketing processes and finding ways to improve efficiency and quality of workExperience and comfort working within MarTech platforms such as DAMs, Marketing Automation, Audience Management, and Project Management Ability to identify and mitigate risk through adherence to regulations and best practicesExperience creating and delivering trainings and materials that promote awareness and inspire adoptionBachelor’s degree or equivalentExceptional organizational and communication skills 

EOE STATEMENT

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

CCPA DISCLOSURE

Personal Information Collection Notice: This notice contains information under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) about the categories of personal information (PI) of California residents that Manufacturers Bank collects and the business or commercial purpose(s) for which the PI may be used. We do not sell PI. More information about our collection and use of PI may be found in our CCPA Privacy Policy at https://www.manufacturersbank.com/CCPA-Privacy. Persons with disabilities may contact our Customer Contact Center toll-free at (877) 560-9812 to request the information in this Notice in an alternative format.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
